definition: willingly
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
to hope/to wish/to desire/hoped-for/ready/willing

sentences.english: That a separate the world empty thoughts, like poison, always let a person willing to sink.
sentences.chinese: 那一份隔世離空的思念，宛如毒藥，總讓人甘願沉淪。

sentences.english: If you find out that Han Xiaoou is a spy, he is willing to lose his head.
sentences.chinese: 如果將來查出韓曉鷗是特務，他甘願掉腦袋。

sentences.english: It became known to all that she had a boyfriend who was ready to sacrifice everything for her.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人都知道她有一個爲她甘願付出的男友。

sentences.english: There are many small countries bow their head to Da T'ang at that time.
sentences.chinese: 當時大唐周邊許多小國甘願俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: So he put aside his dignity, they are willing to Wu to become a pawn.
sentences.chinese: 於是他放下尊嚴，甘願到吳國去當馬前卒。

sentences.english: When enough people are willing to help, then we will succeed.
sentences.chinese: 當有足夠的人民甘願幫助時，我們就會成功。

sentences.english: No matter it is fully blooming or silently declining, willingness and respect we keep to it are always there.
sentences.chinese: 不管是竭力盛放，還是靜默頹敗，都如此甘願和珍重。

sentences.english: He was a rounder's son named Westley.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個圓的兒子名叫維斯特利甘願出個。

sentences.english: We are willing to look like fools to test things for our readers.
sentences.chinese: 爲了我們的讀者，我們甘願做這樣的傻事。

sentences.english: Born as human beings, how can we be willing to equate ourselves to animals?
sentences.chinese: 作爲人，我們又怎能甘願讓自己與旁生不分高低呢？

sentences.english: The flowers refuse to be snapped off the branches and lose their soul.
sentences.chinese: 不甘願被折離枝端失去了靈魂。

sentences.english: How many kings step down from their thrones?
sentences.chinese: 有多少帝王甘願步下他們的王座？

sentences.english: Because of breach of the villagers, the incense are willing to be punished stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 因失信村民，金香甘願受罰退位讓賢。

sentences.english: If the experiment is not successful,I am ready to pack it in.
sentences.chinese: 如果試驗不成功，我甘願承認失敗。

sentences.english: You would be a sweet surrender but I must go the other way.
sentences.chinese: 即使你甘願放棄我也只有遠走他鄉。

sentences.english: I would sooner resign than work under that boss.
sentences.chinese: 我甘願辭職也不願在那個老闆手底下工作。

definition: delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
unwilling/unwillingness
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
even if/even though
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
should not/to owe nothing
to take pity on/pity/mercy
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
considerate (of other people's needs)
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
